etymologies: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin consolatio(n-), from the verb consolari (see console)

definitions: the comfort received by a person after a loss or disappointment

examples.text: there was consolation in knowing that others were worse off

shortDefinitions: comfort received by person after loss or disappointment

definitions: a person or thing providing comfort to a person who has suffered

examples.text: the Church was the main consolation in a short and hard life

definitions: (in sports) a round or contest for tournament entrants who have been eliminated before the finals, often to determine third and fourth place.
shortDefinitions: round or contest for tournament entrants who have been eliminated before finals
